item.title: Midjourney plans to let anyone on the web edit images with AI
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Midjourney is planning to release an upgraded web tool that’ll let users edit any uploaded images from the web using Midjourney’s generative AI. The upgraded tool, which Midjourney CEO David Holtz said will be released “early next week,” will also allow users to retexture objects in images to “repaint” their colors and details according to […]

item.title: 23andMe faces an uncertain future — so does your genetic data
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
Financial and security chaos at the once-pioneering genetic testing firm has intensified concerns about user data. Here's how to take action.

item.title: Match’s random video chat app Azar could be the next Chatroulette — for better or for worse
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Azar has facilitated over 100 billion video chats with its app, which randomly connects strangers around the globe. But until recently, the Seoul-based app — which shares a parent company, Match, with Tinder, Hinge, and OkCupid — hasn’t been available in the U.S. The U.S. market could be tough to crack. For millennials who grew […]

item.title: Claude: Everything you need to know about Anthropic’s AI
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Anthropic, the AI vendor second in size only to OpenAI, has a powerful family of generative AI models called Claude. These models can perform a range of tasks, from captioning images and writing emails to solving math and coding challenges. With Anthropic’s model ecosystem growing so quickly, it can be tough to keep track of […]

item.title: SpaceX wins $733M Space Force launch contract
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
SpaceX was awarded an eight-launch, $733 million contract by the U.S. Space Force on Friday, as part of an ongoing program intended to foster competition among launch providers. The award includes seven launches for the Space Development Agency and one for the National Reconnaissance Office, all anticipated to use Falcon 9s and occur no earlier […]

item.title: Eric Schmidt’s SandboxAQ aims for $5B valuation for its AI/quantum Google moonshot

item.description:
SandboxAQ began as Alphabet’s moonshot AI and quantum computing and now has an impressive roster of projects.

item.title: This $600 Buzz Lightyear toy is the most realistic yet
item.dc:creator: Yashad Kulkarni
item.description:
Do you have $600 burning an asteroid-sized hole in your pocket? If so, the new Buzz Lightyear robot might be for you. A collaboration between Pixar and smart toy company Robosen, the new Buzz is fully loaded with more than 3,000 tiny parts, 75 microchips, and 23 servo motors. It also features what Robosen calls […]

item.title: Fluid Truck files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and pursues sale after leadership shakeup
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Less than two months after Fluid Truck’s board ousted its sibling co-founders from their executive positions, the company has laid off 30% of its staff, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, and found a potential buyer to take on the business, pending court approval, according to bankruptcy filings and information from a former employee.  Fluid […]

item.title: Acrew Capital hits five years, raises $700M
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Acrew Capital has raised $700 million in fresh funds. The San Francisco-based venture capital firm announced in a blog post on Thursday that it raised $700 million to invest in companies building in data and security, healthcare, or fintech. This fundraise brings the firm’s assets under management to $1.7 billion. It’s unclear how much of […]

item.title: Why changes to the block on Elon Musk’s X are driving users away
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Elon Musk’s X is planning to make a change to how the block function works, breaking from the established standards of other social media apps. When the policies around blocking change, people who have been blocked by someone will still be able to see that person’s posts, so long as they’re public. They just won’t […]

item.title: Investors bet on the power of light, diamonds in the trash, and more

item.description:
Welcome to Startups Weekly — your weekly recap of everything you can’t miss from the world of startups. Want it in your inbox every Friday? Sign up here. item.title: Microsoft could end up with substantial equity in the restructured, for-profit OpenAI
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
How much equity in OpenAI will Microsoft get once the former becomes a for-profit company? That’s the multibillion-dollar question — one the two parties are racing to answer ahead of a two-year deadline. The Wall Street Journal reports that both Microsoft and OpenAI have hired investment banks to negotiate Microsoft’s equity — which could be […]

item.title: WP Engine files an injunction to get its WordPress.org access back
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Web hosting provider WP Engine has filed an injunction in a court in Northern California, asking it to intervene and restore its access to the WordPress.org open source repository. After WP Engine filed a lawsuit against WordPress co-creator Matt Mullenweg and Automattic last month, Mullenweg — who also owns WordPress.org — blocked the company’s access […]

item.title: Bluesky surges into the top 5 as X changes blocks, permits AI training on its data
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Social networking startup Bluesky, which just reported a gain of half a million users over the past day, has now soared into the top five apps on the U.S. App Store and has become the No. 2 app in the Social Networking category, up from No. 181 a week ago, according to data from app […]

item.title: Tesla’s Full Self-Driving software under investigation by federal safety regulator
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
The U.S. automotive safety regulator has opened a new investigation into Tesla's Full Self-Driving (Supervised) software after four reported crashes in low-visibility situations.

item.title: Nebius to resume Nasdaq trading after severing ties with Russia and Yandex
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Nebius, the company formerly known as Yandex that’s now focused on cloud infrastructure for AI uses (aka “AI compute”), is to begin trading on the public markets once again — more than two years after the Nasdaq halted trading due to economic sanctions imposed in the wake of Russia’s Ukraine invasion in 2022. The Netherlands-based company […]

item.title: Byju’s founder says his edtech startup, once worth $22B, is now ‘worth zero’
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Byju Raveendran, the founder of the embattled edtech group Byju’s, acknowledged on Thursday afternoon that he made mistakes, mistimed the market, overestimated growth potential, and that his startup, once valued at $22 billion, is now effectively worth “zero.” Speaking to a group of journalists, Raveendran said the company’s aggressive acquisition of more than two dozen […]

item.title: The surprising way OpenAI could get out of its pact with Microsoft
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description:
The New York Times on Thursday published a look at the “fraying” relationship between OpenAI and its investor, partner, and, increasingly, rival, Microsoft, reporting their five-year romance has cooled owing to financial pressure on OpenAI, the limited computing power Microsoft is providing OpenAI, and disagreements between the two about ground rules. Most fascinating perhaps is […]

item.title: Former watch trader is now building the AWS of grid storage, Terralayr
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The startup's technology is a twist on the virtual power plant concept, in which batteries are aggregated and portions of the whole are sold off to various customers.
